page.title: 11HISTORY.
page.content: As a Catholic, Richard Shireburne was reported to Elizabeth 1 in 1591 as a recusant who did not attend the Protestant Church and who was a spy for the Lancashire Catholics. A house (Stonyhurst College) was begun in 1594. Oliver Cromwell is reported to have slept at Stonyhurst College on the night before the Battle of Preston in 1648. The bridge over the Lower Hodder still bears the name "Cromwell's Bridge". In 1717 the male-line of the Shireburnes died out and, on the death of Mary Shireburne, the estates passed to the Weld family of Lulworth. The house remained empty for 40 years until Thomas Weld, an ex-scholar of the Jesuit Fathers, gave the house to the Society of Jesus who had been expelled from Belgium in 1794. This was the start of Stonyhurst College.
